exclusion:
1. Set the primary controller to add mode (secure/non-secure).
  2. Press the configuration button or switch connected to S1 x 3 times in rapid succession.
  3. The device LED will blink in green when adding procedure has been successfully initiated.

When the device has been included in the home automation system, the LED will stay green for 3 seconds. The device is now ready for use with default settings.
inclusion:
1. Set the primary controller to add mode (secure/non-secure).
  2. Press the configuration button or switch connected to S1 x 3 times in rapid succession.
  3. The device LED will blink in green when adding procedure has been successfully initiated.

When the device has been included in the home automation system, the LED will stay green for 3 seconds. The device is now ready for use with default settings.
label: Heatit ZM Relay
overview:
Heatit ZM Single Relay is a high power relay for in-wall installations. The relay allows you to control connected devices either through your Z-Wave network or via a wired switch. The module is equipped with a 16A relay and has a scene controller functionality.

The Heatit ZM Single Relay has a power metering feature that allows you to monitor the power consumption of your connected devices.

Supports encryption modes S0, S2 Authenticated Class, S2 Unauthenticated Class

category.label: Power Outlet
category.description: Small devices to be plugged into a power socket in a wall which stick there

parameters.label: Load Limit
parameters.description: Ensures that the device does not draw more current than rated. Immunity for power consumption peaks.

parameters.label: Power shutdown actions
parameters.description: Decide how the device should react when the overload/overheating features has turned relay OFF.
parameters.overview:
0 - Disabled and will not retry. User needs to manually turn on afterwards. If temperature overload is on, device will not turn on until device has cooled down.

32767 - After power shut down (param 1) device will try to turn back ON after delay specified here (time in minutes).

parameters.label: Switch Type
parameters.description: Decides what type of switch is connected.

parameters.label: S1/Button operation
parameters.overview:
0 - Button turns load on/off and sends Meter report + Relay status.

1 - Button sends Meter report + Relay status, load can be only controlled wirelessly.

parameters.label: Scene notifications
parameters.description: Decides if/what scene controller notifications the device sends to gateway.
parameters.overview:
0 - Sends scene controller for S2. S1 disabled.

1 - Sends scene controller for S1. S2 disabled.

2 - Sends scene controller for S1 and S2.

3 - Scene controller deactivated.

parameters.label: Restore Power Level
parameters.description: Relay power level after power is restored from power-outage.When device is from factory/factory reset the first state of the device should be OFF.
parameters.overview:
0 - Always OFF on restored power.

1 - Always ON on restored power.

2 - Restore last state on restored power).

parameters.label: Automatic turn OFF
parameters.description: Time to turn relay OFF after having been turned ON.
parameters.overview:
0 - Auto OFF disabled.

1 - 86400 - Auto Off timeout in seconds.

parameters.label: Automatic turn ON
parameters.description: Time to turn relay ON after having been turned OFF.
parameters.overview:
0 - Auto ON disabled.

1 - 86400 - Auto ON timeout in seconds.

parameters.label: Inverted Output
parameters.description: Decides if the relay output should be inverted

parameters.label: Meter report interval
parameters.description: Time interval between consecutive meter reports. Meter reports can also be sent as a result of polling.

parameters.label: Meter report delta value
parameters.description: Decides the delta for meter in Watt for the device issue meter report. This parameter will issue W.

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview:
Lifeline. (Normally used by the Z-Wave Controller) Sends: - Device Reset Notifications.

- Indicator Report

- Configuration Report

- Meter Report

- Central Scene Notification

- Notification Command Class

Basic Reports

(0x00, 0xFF) ON/OFF
